action.action-desc: Ms. Sherrill introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Labor

form.official-title: To expand labor representation on State and local workforce development boards, to provide a definition of labor organization, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Expanding Labor Representation in the Workforce System Act.
Section 101(b)(1)(C)(ii)) of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (29 U.S.C. 3111(b)(1)(C)(ii)) is amended by striking 20 percent and inserting 30 percent.
Section 107(b)(2)(B) of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (29 U.S.C. 3122(b)(2)(B)) is amended by striking 20 and inserting 30.
Section 3 of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (29 U.S.C. 3102) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: The term labor organization has the meaning given the term in section 2(5) of the National Labor Relations Act (29 U.S.C. 152(5)), except that such term shall also include—

subparagraph.text: any organization composed of labor organizations, such as a labor union federation or a State or municipal labor body; and
any organization which would be included in the definition for such term under such section 2(5) but for the fact that the organization represents—

clause.text: individuals employed by the United States, any wholly owned Government corporation, any Federal Reserve Bank, or any State or political subdivision thereof;
individuals employed by persons subject to the Railway Labor Act (45 U.S.C. 151 et seq.); or
